values.content: You are a multilingual expert AI assistant specialized in parsing business website content.

=Your task is to extract a comprehensive and detailed description of what the company does from the provided text.
Always output in English, regardless of the input language.

⸻

Objective

Read and interpret the input (which may be in Swedish or English) and produce a structured JSON output containing:
	•	A single, detailed “description” field summarizing what the company does — 
including:
	•	Core activities, products, or services
	•	Methods, technologies, or approaches used
	•	Target audience or customer segments
	•	Mission, values, or brand philosophy
	•	What makes the company unique or differentiated

⸻

Rules
	•	Always output in English — translate if necessary.
	•	Focus only on describing what the company does (no name or metadata).
	•	The description should be rich, specific, and professional, reflecting the company’s positioning and purpose.
	•	The output must be valid JSON — no extra text or comments outside of the JSON block.
	•	Use complete sentences and a natural narrative style.

⸻

Output Format
{
  "description": "Bright Interaction is a digital experience agency that designs human-centered interfaces and interactive solutions for global brands. The company specializes in combining behavioral psychology with cutting-edge UX design to create emotionally engaging customer experiences. Their target clients include technology-driven businesses and consumer brands seeking to elevate user engagement through intuitive and data-informed design."
}

Input:
{{ $json.cleanText }}

 Notes
	•	If the input is in another language (e.g., Swedish), interpret it accurately but write the output only in English.
	•	Never output anything except the JSON structure above.

parameters.content:
# Discovery Call Worklflow

This workflow connects Cal.com, Pipedrive, and Slack to automate what happens when someone books, reschedules, or cancels a meeting.

The goal is to keep the CRM organized, save manual work, and make sure every meeting and lead is properly tracked and enriched.

⸻

## What It Does

	•	Receives bookings from Cal.com (Discovery Calls).
	•	Creates or updates the person, company, and activity in Pipedrive.
	•	Updates or closes activities automatically when meetings are rescheduled or cancelled.
	•	Adds a summary and links (website, Allabolag, notes) to the CRM so you’re prepared before the call.
	•	Sends a Slack notification when a new call is booked.
	•	Logs errors to Airtable for easy tracking if something fails.

⸻

## How It Works

	1.	Webhook trigger: Cal.com sends booking data to n8n.
	2.	Switch node: Routes based on event type (create, update, cancel).
	3.	CRM search: Checks if the person/company already exists.
	4.	Conditional logic:
	•	If found → Update existing records.
	•	If not found → Create new ones.
	5.	Activity handling:
	•	Creates or updates the meeting in Pipedrive.
	•	Adds enrichment notes and links.
	6.	Slack alert: Notifies the sales channel with meeting details.
	7.	Error handling: Any failed steps are logged for review.

⸻

## Why It Exists

To eliminate repetitive admin work after someone books a meeting —
so the CRM stays up to date, meetings are ready with context, and you can focus on the call instead of setup.

parameters.subject: =No problem, let’s find a better time
parameters.message:
=Hey {{ $json.body.payload.responses.name.value.split(" ")[0] }}, Thanks for letting me know. Totally understand things come up.

Let’s lock in a time that suits you better. This’ll be a quick run-through of how we remove all the manual work from sales and onboarding within 30 days or less, freeing your team to focus on closing more deals.

You can grab a new slot here.

Or just reply with a day that works best.

Best,
Tom

Tom Isgren
Founder @ Bright Interaction

parameters.subject: =No worries about today, {{ $json.body.payload.responses.name.value.split(" ") [0] }}
parameters.message:
=Hey {{ $json.body.payload.responses.name.value.split(" ")[0] }},

Totally understand that things can get busy. Let’s keep it simple.

When the timing feels right, I can walk you through how we help teams remove the manual work from their sales and onboarding within 30 days or less, so your reps can focus on closing more deals.

Would you like me to circle back in a few weeks, or do you want to grab a new slot now while it’s top of mind?

Kind regards,
Tom
